title: I like thi...
description: I like this game, but I don't love it.+ Fun theme+ Easy to learn - Runs too long- Turns are too similar- Gameplay doesn't evolve throughout the game enough - All the games I played, the winner was who got the hand size upgrade first It's a fun game, but not amazing.

title: This will ...
description: This will be always be my top 5. While there are lots of minor rules, the strategies are quite clear. The modular building-laying mechanism, immediate rewards etc. The first game that I would want to drill on the combos.

title: Alexander ...
description: Alexander Pfister's best rated game. Played twice and really enjoyed it, so have added this one to the collection. A long, but very enjoyable game.

title: Great deck...
description: Great deck building mechanism for a grander purpose. Makes you feel exactly like you are breeding those cows, herding them along and delivering them to market. All from the comfort of your chair. None of that hard riding real life affords.

title: Shit Cows ...
description: Shit Cows is damned fun. need to play it more when Gloomhaven isn't taking over my life again.

title: Pretty goo...
description: Pretty good--the different moving parts intersect in reasonably satisfying ways, and there seems to be a genuine plurality of strategic options and a need to specialize. That said,the game is probably longer than it wants to be, and the player interaction is pretty nonexistent.

title: Turned Pla...
description:
Turned Play - Race Finish
Linear Board Movement
Location Action
Card Drafting - Deck Building - Hand Management
Resource Purchase
Tile Placement - Modular Board
Parallel Area Control
Victory Point Scoring
Competitive Interference

title: Great Euro...
description: Great Euro that I want to play more. It has a fantastic mechanic where you place actions on the board instead of placing workers.

title: Don't thin...
description:
Don't think I'll do well enough at this to win, but more play is going to improve my performance.
The specific things building do will be important to remember. In my second game another player and I both placed one particular building right near the end, only to then realise that it would leave us at least one card down for the delivery.

I do better than I'd expected I would. Not entirely sure how, but I'm winning more than I lose.
